description:
Mutta's life has hit rock bottom. He's been fired, blackballed from his profession and now he's had to move back in with his parents. Meanwhile, his kid brother Hibito has been literally riding a rocket and training to be an astronaut. The same career Mutta once dreamed of. So, is it ever too late to go after your dreams? Through a little coercing and a bit of covert activity, Mutta's family and friends can get his resume on the right desk, but from that point on it will be up to Mutta himself. Does he have what it takes to turn his life around and put his footprint on the moon? The first step on the highway to the stars is always the hardest, and in a job where crash and burn isn't just a euphemism, it will be the biggest risk Mutta's ever taken. But with the best support team ever, maybe he'll find what he needs to rekindle the spark inside him and light the biggest candle of them all!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Aviation
tags.description: Regarding the flying or operation of aircraft.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Rescue
tags.description: Centers around operations that carry out urgent treatment of injuries, remove people from danger, or save lives. This includes series that are about search-and-rescue teams, trauma surgeons, firefighters, and more.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fusatora2828) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mangetsuhakase)

While attending Waseda University, Mochizuki became interested in animation and he joined the Waseda University Animation Association. In 1981, he began working for Ajia-do Animation Works. Mochizuki made his debut one year later when he acted as production director of the 1982 series Tokimeki Tonight. He went on to direct several of the magical girl series, including Magical Angel Creamy Mami. In 1986, he moved up to chief director with Hikari no Densetsu.

Mochizuki became known from the early 1990s as director of Ranma ½, Kimagure Orange Road and the Studio Ghibli TV movie Ocean Waves, he is also known for having directed Twin Spica, Zettai Shounen, the acclaimed World Masterpiece Theater series Porphy no Nagai Tabi. More recently he directed the noitaminA series House of Five Leaves in 2010 and Battery in 2016.

He currently divides his time between directing, writing scripts and acting as a series coordinator for various shows.

Married to [Masako Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/153654/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uchu_kyodai) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/chuyakoyama) | [Official Website](https://koyamachuya.com/)

He is a Japanese mangaka, best known for his Space Brothers series, published regularly since 2007. On 2 November 2016 his artwork was carried into space by the H-IIA rocket carrying the Himawari-9 weather satellite as part of an outreach project organized by the Young Astronauts Club Japan.

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.

Fukuhara Miho  is a Japanese pop star who made an indies debut in 2006, releasing a single titled "The Roots" and mini-album titled Step Out. In early 2008, she made her major-label debuted under Sony Music Entertainment Japan . Her debut single, "Change", was the number ninety-two yearly song on the Billboard Japan Hot 100 Singles year-end charts for 2008. With her single "Let It Out", she had her first major anime tie-in (in particular, with Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood).

__[Website (New)](https://www.doesdoesdoes.com/)__ | __[Website (Old)](http://www.does-net.com)__ | __Twitter__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/doesdoes)__ __Formed:__ 2000, Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan __Genres:__ Rock (Garage, Alternative and Hard Rock) Biography DOES is a three-piece Japanese rock band. DOES initially begun performing in Fukuoka where they continued to write songs and perform gigs until 2005. In 2005, some members left and the group went on hiatus. Releasing singles since 2004, DOES signed with Ki/oon Records in 2006. In 2008, their 6th single “Donten” reached 3rd on the Oricon weekly music ranking charts. It was also the 5th opening for the anime Gintama. On April 21, 2010, the band released their single "Bakuchi Dancer." The single sold around 33,000 copies in its initial week and debuted at number 3 on the Oricon weekly charts. The single ended up to be the 30th best selling single for the first half of 2010 and the 74th best single of the entire year. On November 14, 2012, the band released the single "Yumemiru Sekai" which is also the third opening for Space Brothers. In summer 2014 they released a CD single called "Guren" to be used as the 15th opening to the anime Naruto Shippuuden. On August 6, 2014, their special sixth album DOES was on a big sale. On January 1, 2020, after a 3-year and 4-month hiatus the band announced their comeback, and have started to resume activites as a three-piece rock band. Members - [Wataru Ujihara](https://anilist.co/staff/148617) (氏原ワタル) - Lead vocalist, Guitarist - Yasushi Akatsuka (赤塚ヤスシ) - Bass Guitarist, Chorus - Kēsaku Morita (森田ケーサク) - Drummer, Chorus (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

Sukima Switch (スキマスイッチ?) is a Japanese jazz fusion duo consisting of core members Takuya Ōhashi (大橋卓弥 Ōhashi Takuya?), born May 9, 1978, and Shintarō Tokita (常田真太郎 Tokita Shintarō?), born February 25, 1978, formed in 2003. Formerly with BMG Japan (bought by SMEJ in early 2009), they signed with Sony Music Japan's Ariola Japan label in September 2009.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B8%A1%E8%BE%BA%E6%AD%A9)

Ayumu Watanabe is a director, screenwriter, storyboard artist and a former animator.

[Official Website](http://www.toshiyuki-watanabe.com/)

He is a composer and arranger who has scored several films and anime, most notably the Mothra films in the 1990s. He is the son of legendary tokusatsu and anime composer, [Chuumei Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/169740).

__[Website](https://www.fujifabric.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fujifabric_info) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fujifabric) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/fujifabricSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2000

__Biography:__
Fujifabric was initially formed by Masahiko Shimura in the early 2000s and consisted of five members. They released their first mini album in 2002 titled _A la carte_, and later made their major debut with "Sakura no Kisetsu" through record label EMI Music Japan (known as Toshiba EMI at the time) on April 14, 2004. 

After being active for 9 years, the band would go through a sudden change when Shimura died at the age of 29 on December 24, 2009. At the time the band consisted of four members, Masahiko Shimura, a vocalist and guitarist, Souichirou Yamauchi, a guitarist, Daisuke Kanazawa, a keyboardist, and Shinichi Katou, a bassist. The remaining members decided to continue band activities as a three-piece band, with Souichirou taking over as the vocalist.

__Members:__
- Souichirou Yamauchi (山内総一郎) – vocalist and guitarist
- [Daisuke Kanazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/209456/Daisuke-Kanazawa) (金澤ダイスケ) – keyboardist, lyricist and composer
- Shinichi Katou (加藤慎一) – bassist
Had official debut in 2010. Currently lives in Sendai.
Consists of 5 guys. Founded in 1986 in Hiroshima.
